translation: Second Fascicle of the Sutra on the Twelve Conditions for Producing Auspicious Gems, Volume II

source_sentence: 西天譯經三藏朝散大夫試鴻臚
translation: Xitian zhuan jing sanzang朝散 dafu xi Hongun

source_sentence: 少卿傳法大師臣施護奉　詔譯
translation: Shaoqing zhuanfa daishi zhi shen hu Feng imperial edict translated

source_sentence: 注云：「有支順轉，積日逆流，黑白月餘，如經廣說。」
translation: The commentary says, There's a branch that goes along with the accumulation of days going against the flow, and it's more than a month in black and white, as explained in detail in the sūtras.

source_sentence: 爾時眾會，無量人天，白世尊言：「烏鳥鳴吟，時來不定，如何了知？
translation: At the time, measureless people and gods in the assembly said to the Bhagavān, How can we know that crows and birds are singing at an ungodly hour?
May the Buddha expound it.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊告諸大眾：「若復有人，於十二支，審諦觀察，了知憂喜。
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed the crowd, Suppose there's another person who carefully observes the twelve limbs and knows grief and joy.

source_sentence: 若無明支日，烏鳴於右，妻女見喜；
translation: On the day of the branch of nescience, the crow crows on the right and their wives and daughters are delighted to see it.
The crow cries to the left, and the pedestrians will surely come.

source_sentence: 「於行支日，右鳴安吉、左鳴獲財。
translation: On the day of the practice branch, he sounds Good fortune on the right and acquires wealth on the left.

source_sentence: 「於識支日，右鳴所望必得遂意；
translation: On the day of the branch of consciousness, when he calls it right, his wishes will surely be fulfilled.
Nothing he wished for was accomplished when he cried out to the left.

source_sentence: 「於名色支，右鳴得財、左鳴囹圄。
translation: In the name-and-form branch, it sounds wealthy on the right and imprisoned on the left.

source_sentence: 「於六入支，右鳴驚怖、左鳴諍訟。
translation: In the six sense-entering limbs, he sounds terrified on the right and wails in anger on the left.

source_sentence: 「於觸支日，右鳴驚怖、左鳴家人至。
translation: On the day of touching the branch, he cries out in fear to his right and cries out to his left as a householder arriving.
On the day he receives the precepts, he calls out in his right hand to express his wishes.
On his left side, he sounded the bell to gain faith and lost all his possessions.

source_sentence: 「於愛支日，右鳴安樂、左獲善信。
translation: On the day of the beloved branch, he sounds peaceful on his right and gains good faith on his left.

source_sentence: 「於取支日，右鳴苦辛、左獲安吉。
translation: On the day he takes the branch, he'll sound painful and auspicious on his right and attain good fortune on his left.

source_sentence: 「於有支日，右鳴人問、左鳴安吉。
translation: On the day when there's a branch, he calls out for someone to ask questions on his right and sounds peaceful on his left.

source_sentence: 「於生支日，右鳴所求和合遂意；
translation: On the day of the branch of rebirth (i.e., the first part of the Buddha’s life), he sounded his right hand and fulfilled what he wished for in harmony with his mind.
On his left, he sounded the bell to gain faith, and his possessions were scattered.
In the branch of old age and death, he cries out to his right without any trouble.
The left one sounds disruptive, and his possessions are small.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊告眾會言：「若復有人，於無明支，烏鳴北方，必獲來信。
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed the assembly, saying, Suppose there's another person who crows to the north in the branch of nescience and will surely attain faith.

source_sentence: 「於行支日，烏鳴北方，有喜事獲。
translation: “On the day of the practice branch, a crow crows in the northern direction with joyful deeds.

source_sentence: 「於識支日，鳴北安吉，諧和遂意。
translation: On the day of the consciousness factor, he sounded the bell for northern good fortune and harmonized his mind with harmony.

source_sentence: 「於名色支，北方鳴時，聞悅意事。
translation: “When the name-and-form branch sounds in the north, they hear delightful things.

source_sentence: 「於六入支，烏鳴北方，獲路遠事，財寶去遙，必非和合。
translation: To the north of the six sense-fields, crows singing in the north, there's a distant path that's been obtained, and possessions are far away, so it mustn't be a combination.

source_sentence: 「於觸支日，烏鳴北方，有諍訟起。
translation: On the day of the tangible branch, there's a dispute in the north with the crow singing.
Accept the branch of the sun and sound it, and you'll be in good health in the north.
“The branch of craving is sounded to the north, far removed from bondage.
Taking the northern sound of Zhixi, he suddenly got faith in it.
If there's a branch that sounds north, his clothes and possessions will surely be obtained.
The northern sound of the arising branch is heard, and people come to ask questions.
Old age and death ring out in the north, and all are safe.

source_sentence: 時諸大眾白世尊言：「心齶上眴，云何了知？」
translation: The assembled crowd then said to the Bhagavān, How do you know this?

source_sentence: 爾時世尊告大眾曰：「若復有人，於十二支，憶念不忘，悉皆了達。
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed the crowd, Suppose another person remembers and doesn't forget the twelve limbs, and they all understand them.

source_sentence: 若無明支，齶上眴動，大聖者至。
translation: If there's a branch of nescience, the palate shakes and the great sage arrives.
Every day, the practice branch is disciplined, and the parents are peaceful.
The consciousness branch will surely come, and the noble one will surely come.
“The name-and-form branch of the monastery obtained a great deal of property.
“The six sense faculties of entry are debilitating, and afflictions arise in the mind.
“When touched by a branch of the palate, it's appropriate to be happy and joyous.
“When he receives the precepts every day, there’s something frightening and terrifying.
“The branch of craving grows in strength day by day, increasing the family’s wealth.
On the day he took Zhizhi, one of them died.
“There is a branch of the sun that rises in the sky and the holy one comes.
On the day when the branch of giving is cut, thieves will surely arrive.
“The branch of old age and death is cut off, and the family is united.

source_sentence: 「若復有人，觀十二支，了知憂喜。
translation: “Suppose another person observes the twelve limbs and knows grief and joy.

source_sentence: 於無明支，心上眴動，諍訟煩惱。
translation: On the branch of nescience, there is torpor and dispute and defilement in the mind.
Every day, the practitioner's branch earned money and possessions.
“The mental branch of consciousness is depressed, and there are frightening things.
Their name and form are depressed, and their parents rejoice.

source_sentence: 「六入支眴，於所求事，和合現前。
translation: “The six sense-entering limbs are combined and manifested in terms of the things they seek.
The touch factor is debilitating to the mind, and parents are frightened.

source_sentence: 「受支心眴，南行禳之，乃可宜吉。
translation: It's better to go south and cross the river with a heart that's depressed by feeling anguish.
The branch of craving is so angry that it causes great grief and distress.
When the branch of grasping is cut off, there's a bad person who arrives.
“There are parts of the mind that are depressed, and there are sorrowful things.
When the arising branch of mind is depressed, it must be greatly fearful.

source_sentence: 「老死支日心上眴動，老者必卒。」
translation: On the day of the branch of old age and death, his mind is agitated, and the old man will surely die.

source_sentence: 爾時大眾復白佛言：「此十二支，有此祥瑞，於日用事，未能了知，復云何行，
translation: It was then that the great assembly again said to the Buddha: These twelve members of the sangha hold these auspicious omens. They are not able to know the functioning of the sun and the moon, so how can they be performed?
Please explain it.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊告大眾言：「若復有人，於無明支及行支日，聚會筵設、修飾田宅、問事見貴、洗頭等吉；
translation: It was then that the World-honored One said to the assembly of bhikṣus: Again, suppose there is another person who on the day of the branch of nescience and the other branches of reasoning (i.e., the seventh or eighth month) wishes to assemble for a meal, decorate his land and house, inquire about matters of value,
Don't use it for washing, bathing, and making clothes.

source_sentence: 「於行支日，求事聽法、習學弧矢、收伏冤賊、澡浴親貴、皆宜善用；
translation: On the day of religious practice, they should seek to serve and listen to the Dharma, practice and learn archery and arrows, subdue enemies and thieves, bathe their relatives and friends, and use them well.

source_sentence: 洗頭有患，作衣退敗，慎勿用之。
translation: When you wash your hair with a troubled hair, make sure not to use it because the clothes will fall off.

source_sentence: 「於識支日，王受灌頂、伏冤收軍、修營聚落、州府舍宅、成就皆吉，
translation: On the day of the consciousness branch, the king receives the consecration, subdues his enemies, withdraws his troops, builds villages and homes, and accomplishes all good fortune.
It is advisable to wash the hair on one’s throat and make clean clothes.
Being frightened by bathing, it's advisable to be cautious.

source_sentence: 「若名色支，諸所作事、及常住事、剃除髮爪、財物收藏、皆善宜用；
translation: “Good son, the members of name and form—the things they do, the things they always practice, shave their nails, store up all their possessions, and use them appropriately.

source_sentence: 洗頭色變，澡浴驚怖，若作衣時，獲喜速破。
translation: When he washes his hair the color changes and bathes, he's frightened; if he makes a robe, he'll be delighted and quickly break it.

source_sentence: 「六入支日，王受灌頂、修治聚落、圓滿成就、他人勿拜、遷動新宅、財物遠離、收護獲罪；
translation: On the sixth day of the nirvana, the king receives the ordination, develops his villages, completes their development, does not worship others, moves into a new dwelling place, keeps his property free from them, and collects and protects [those who commit crimes].

source_sentence: 若澡浴時，父母驚怖，若洗頭時，名稱無怖。
translation: When he bathes, his parents are frightened, and when he washes his hair, his reputation isn't feared.

source_sentence: 「於觸支日，作善不成、惡事害人、罪犯速成。
translation: On the day of touch, he doesn't perform good deeds, harms people with bad deeds, and quickly commits crimes.

source_sentence: 於取支日，一切所為、父母驚怖、澡浴作衣、愛人非久，必有血光，作衣未浴，
translation: On the day of taking the precepts, everything that he does, his parents are frightened, he's bathed and made a robe, and it won't be long before he loves them, but there must be a bloody light on the day when he makes a robe without bathing.
It's better not to put it on.

source_sentence: 「於受支日，所求事喜、交易布施、修治精舍、吉慶宜用；
translation: On the day of accepting the precepts, they should be delighted with what they seek, trade in and give alms, cultivate their monasteries, and use them appropriately for auspicious occasions.

source_sentence: 洗頭驚怖，獲不遂意，若作衣時，所希非難，宜對友人著之前吉。
translation: When he washes his hair, he's frightened and doesn't get what he wishes. If he makes a robe, what he wishes isn't difficult, so it's better to give an auspicious gift to a friend who wears it in front of him.

source_sentence: 「於愛支日，資具珍寶、宜收護吉；
translation: On the day of the craving, it is advisable to store up treasures and keep good fortune.

source_sentence: 輕微急速行用大憂，洗頭髮敗，作衣滿足。
translation: Their swift and swift movement is greatly distressed, and they wash their hair and make a full garment.

source_sentence: 「於取支日，小兒剃髮、所為輕事、皆宜用之；
translation: On the day of taking the precepts, it is advisable for a child to shave his hair and lightly apply whatever he wishes.

source_sentence: 師度弟子、剃除髭髮、服藥和合、送客嫁娶、吉慶富貴、澡浴獲財、作衣逢喜。
translation: The teacher liberates his disciples, shaves off their hair and beard, mixes the medicines with them, sends guests to marry, celebrates prosperity, bathes and obtains wealth, makes robes and meets joy.

source_sentence: 「於有支日，結識交友、及一切事、諍訟遠離，洗頭勿用，作衣澡浴，
translation: On the day of a certain monk, he keeps company with his friends and keeps away from all matters and disputes. He should wash his hair without doing so, don’t use it, make clothes, bathe, and [wear clean] clothing.
It's all appropriate for an auspicious occasion.

source_sentence: 「於生支日，修飾舍宅及鞍馬庫藏、見貴臣主、皆吉宜用；
translation: On the day of the branch of enlightenment, they adorn their homes and storehouses with saddles and horses. They see noble ministers and lords and use them in good fortune.

source_sentence: 澡浴遠行，亦宜用之，及洗頭喜，作衣非久，宜當日著。
translation: It's better to use it for bathing and walking far away, and you should wash your hair with joy. It won't be long before you make your robes, so you should wear them on the same day.

source_sentence: 「老死支日，所起惡事、富者財散、作於利益及論義事、遠離諸非、洗頭速獲、飲食多美、澡浴心惱、作衣長久。」
translation: On the day of the branch of old age and death, bad things arise, wealthy people's possessions are dispersed, they perform benefits and discuss meaningful tasks, part with what's not right, wash their hair to quickly obtain it, eat well-balanced food and drink, bathe their minds, and make robes for a long time.

source_sentence: 於是眾會白世尊言：「足眴地動，烏吟犬吠，油火鼠傷，善惡未了，願為演說。」
translation: The assembly then said to the Bhagavān, My feet touched the ground, crows sang and dogs barked, oil and fire rats were injured, and good and evil have yet to be explained, so please explain it for me.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊告大眾言：「若復有人，於十二支，憶念審察，當知善惡。
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed the crowd, saying, Suppose there's another person who recalls and examines the twelve limbs, knowing what's good and bad.
Why is that?
On the day of the branch of nescience, his feet are covered with joy.

source_sentence: 「於行支日，足眴主事不吉勿用。
translation: On the day of the practice branch, don't use a footstool if it's unfortunate for the master to do so.
The name-and-form of the consciousness branch is discussed here in detail.
On the sixth day of the nirvāṇa, a man with legs on his feet died.

source_sentence: 「觸、受、愛支，此三足眴，諍論事起。
translation: “The members of touch, sensation and craving are the three-legged hindrances that arise in debate.
On the day he took the branch, his feet touched the ground and died.
On the day when there's a branch, his feet are bare and he obtains clothing.
They give rise to the branch-legged abscess, and the thief is in distress and afraid of illness.

source_sentence: 「老死支日，若足眴時，獲悲惱事。
translation: On the day of the branch of old age and death, he'll experience grief and distress when his feet are broken.

source_sentence: 「復次，觀察十二有支，於無明支日，足眴動時，有劫盜至；
translation: “Furthermore, if one observes the twelve links of dependent co-arising, on the day when the link of nescience is broken and his feet tremble, thieves will come.
When the dogs of the house barked, people came to ask questions from afar.
There is nothing to be done by burning clothes.
If a rat snatches your clothes, it will come in distress.
Suppose there is a crow that cries out, and the householders come to ask questions.
When the clothes and oil were soiled, people at once believed in it.
If the earth moves, the king's kindness universally descends.

source_sentence: 「於行支日，足眴動時宜出行吉；
translation: “On the day of the practice branch, it’s advisable to travel in an auspicious way at the time when one’s feet move.
When the dog barks, there is a minor royal duty.
If there were crows singing, good faith would surely come.
And when they saw the blood blazing and their clothes burned, they were delighted.
When the rats grasped their clothes they became very wealthy.
When their clothes and oil were soiled, they acquired a great deal of property.

source_sentence: 若地動時，飢饉劫殺，外國來侵。
translation: When the earth moves, hunger and famine kill people and foreigners invade them.

source_sentence: 「於識支日，足眴動時，有非人至；
translation: On the day of the member of consciousness, when his feet trembled, some non-human beings came.

source_sentence: 有犬吠時，有賊盜至，及獲財物；
translation: When a dog barks, thieves arrive and steal their possessions.
A crow roared and the disputes arose.
If one’s clothes are burned, there is something to be gained.
If a rat bites its clothes, it loses their possessions and gets them back.
When the oil soiled his clothes, his parents were terrified.
When the earth moves, the two kings swallow and annex it.

source_sentence: 「名色支日，足眴獲財，不求自至；
translation: On the day of the members of name and form, they are able to earn their own wealth without seeking it for themselves.
The dog barking man died.
If a crow cries and sings, there will be those who like it.
When a clothed rat is injured, his possessions are lost and he comes back.
There is joy when one’s clothes are burned.
The defilement of clothing or oil is what the great man thinks.

source_sentence: 有地動時，有冤賊起，除剪國靜。
translation: When the earth moves, there are enemies and thieves that arise, except for cutting off the country's quiescence.

source_sentence: 「六入支日，若足眴時，友人遠至，家長安吉；
translation: “On the sixth day of the nirvana, if a friend comes from a distant land at the time when his feet are bared, his parents will be in good health.
A dog barking and arguing is a dispute.
A crow came and did a harmonious service.

source_sentence: 鼠傷衣服，有人水沒而卒；
translation: A rat injured his clothes and some people died when the water sank.
If one’s clothes are burned and damaged, the wealth gained by dispute is lost.
If one’s clothes are soiled with oil or dirt, there will be a fearful event.
When the earth moved, the old man died.

source_sentence: 「於觸支日，若足眴時，喜事得聞；
translation: “On the day of touch, when one’s feet stand on end, he is delighted to hear it.
When the dog was barking, thieves and robbers came.
The crows cried in fear.
When his clothes and rats were damaged, he gained possessions.
When his clothes are burned by fire, he appears to die among the people.
When their robes and oil are soiled, they attain the joy of their followers.
The earth moves like a debate.

source_sentence: 「於受支日，足眴動時，出行宜吉；
translation: On the day he receives the precepts, it will be auspicious for him to go out on a journey when his feet tremble.
When the dogs of the house barked, a holy one came.
When a clothed rat is injured, it will surely be able to see its owner.
When one’s clothes are burned by fire, a small misfortune occurs.
When the oil soiled his clothes, he found something unpleasant.
When the earth moves, it's sure to reach from afar with faith.
“On the day of the branch of thirst, [the king] earned a great deal of money by means of his feet.
If a dog barks at an ungodly hour, there must be anger and dispute.
If a crow cries out, it hears the child’s words with faith.
When a rat wounds its clothes, someone will surely die.
When his clothes were burned in the fire, he gained property.
When the clothes and oil are soiled, there is an auspicious event.

source_sentence: 有地動時，冤賊必起，及有使命，從東而來。
translation: When the earth moves, enemies and thieves will surely arise, and there's a mission that comes from the east.

source_sentence: 「於取支日，足眴獲罪，人卒有信；
translation: On the day he took the precepts, his feet touched the ground and he committed a sin. Everyone had faith in him.
A dog barking at an ungodly hour is a matter of dispute.
When the crow cried aloud, his retinue died.
When a clothed rat is injured, hunger and thirst come upon it.
If one’s clothes and fire were burned, there would surely be something to gain.
When their robes and oil are soiled, they scatter property.
When the earth moves, it comes from an external place and attacks.

source_sentence: 「於有支日，足眴動時，賊來聞信；
translation: “On a certain day, when his feet trembled, thieves came to hear the Master’s words.
When the dog barked at an ungodly hour, the land became unstable.
If a crow cries out, he will surely obtain wealth.
When a clothed rat is injured, the householders and thieves will surely arrive.
When their clothes and food are burned, they get delicious food and drink.
His clothes and oil were full of joy, and the earth moved and grew in abundance.

source_sentence: 「於生支日，足眴動時，遠乘速至；
translation: “On the day of the branch of enlightenment, when his feet trembled, he came from a great distance and quickly.
The dog barked at an ungodly hour and was delighted.
When the crow cries out, there is no peacefulness and harmony.
They wore the clothes of rats and obtained extensive riches.
When the fire damaged the clothes, the merchandise grew larger.
When the clothes and oil are dirty, joy will surely come.
When the earth moves, an army arrives.

source_sentence: 「老死支日，足眴動時，諍論事虛；
translation: “On the day of the link of old age and death, when my feet trembled, I argued in vain about matters.
When the dog barked at an ungodly hour, a friend came from a distance.
When the crow cries aloud, there is dispute and controversy.
When the clothes and rats are damaged, their possessions will be scattered.
When their clothes are burned by fire, there is imprisonment.
His clothes were dyed with spots of oily stain, and he came to discuss matters in detail.
When the earth moves, it's difficult to go east.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊復告大眾：「若復有人，於此緣生十二有支，思念不忘，必能了遠憂喜等事。
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān again addressed the crowd, Suppose another person gives rise to twelve components of existence in these conditions and contemplates them without forgetting them, and they'll surely be able to remove such things as grief and joy.
If it's the day of the branch of nescience, it's advisable to protect possessions.
On the day of the practice branch, he collects and disposes of his possessions.
On the day of the consciousness factor, it's advisable to train in arts and skills.
On the day of the name-and-form branch, it's auspicious for his followers.
On the sixth day of the entering branch, it's auspicious for the formation of consciousness.
“If he touches a branch on the day, it’s advisable to break up enemies.
“On the day of accepting the precepts, it’s advisable to marry and have a bridegroom.

source_sentence: 「於愛支日，奉王命事行禁非法。
translation: On the day of the beloved branch, he serves the king's order to perform forbidden and forbidden duties.
On the day of taking the branch, it's advisable to know the above matter.

source_sentence: 「老死支日，起非法業，正行勿用。」
translation: On the day of the branch of old age and death, do not engage in unlawful activities and don't use right practice.

source_sentence: 時諸大眾白世尊言：「此十二支，於卜問時，云何行之？」
translation: The assembled crowd then said to the Bhagavān, These twelve limbs, how will they be practiced when you're questioned by divination?

source_sentence: 爾時世尊告眾會言：「若復有人，於無明支日，欲求卜問，獲於財物、鞍馬皆吉、眷屬聚會、不永勿用。
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed the assembly, saying, Suppose there's another person who wants to ask for divination on the day of the branch of nescience and obtains property, saddle horses, good fortune, members of his retinue, or something he won't use forever.

source_sentence: 「於行支日，宜卜問事，出行食飲、思子念友、說法皆吉。
translation: On the day of the practice branch, it's advisable to divine and ask questions, travel food and drink, think of your child as a friend, and preach for good fortune.

source_sentence: 「於識支日，若卜問時，事勿動喜、結識知友、不起煩惱、事說成就、災難息除。
translation: On the day of the consciousness factor, if someone asks a question by divination, don't be disturbed by things, know friends with bonds of consciousness, don't give rise to afflictions, explain the accomplishment of things, and remove disasters and difficulties.

source_sentence: 「名色支日，若卜問時，有怖煩惱、事散遍普、骨肉離別。
translation: On the day of the name-and-form branch, if they're asked by divination, there are fears and afflictions, dispersal of things that pervade everywhere, and separation of bones and flesh.

source_sentence: 「六入支日，行卜問時，獲財禮事、及妻室悅、女男分貴。
translation: On the sixth day of the entering month, when he performs divination and questions, he obtains property, rituals, a wife's room, happiness, and the value of women and men.

source_sentence: 「於觸支日，卜問有諍，賊怖憂惱、非理患難、眷屬不和。
translation: On the day of touching the branch, he divines and asks questions with anger, and the thief becomes frightened and distressed, has unreasonable troubles and difficulties, and his followers aren't in harmony.

source_sentence: 「於受支日，求卜問事，多獲財寶、飲食衣物、妻室悅意、莊嚴具足。
translation: On the day he receives the precepts, he seeks divination and asks questions, obtaining a lot of possessions, food and drink, clothing, happiness in his wife's room, and adornment.

source_sentence: 「於愛支日，求卜問事，心思搆畫、虛妄所求、皆非成就。
translation: On the day of the branch of craving, he seeks divination and asks questions, mentally cultivates pictures in his mind, falsely seeking them, and doesn't accomplish them.

source_sentence: 「於取支日，求卜問事，見者歡喜、稱讚護持、座兼所乘、財獲多喜。
translation: On the day he takes the branch, he seeks a divination and asks questions, and when he sees it, those who rejoice, praise it, guard it, sit on it with what they ride, and have great joy in their possessions.

source_sentence: 「於有支日，求卜問事，獲怖王法、破壞憂惱、骨肉離散。
translation: On a day when there's a branch, he seeks divination and asks questions, and he becomes frightened by the king's law, destroys sorrow, and his flesh and bones are scattered.

source_sentence: 「於生支日，求卜問事，獲大財物、一切諧和、圓滿成就、朋友歡喜、珍重稱讚。
translation: On the day of his birth, he sought divination and asked questions, obtaining great wealth, all the harmonies, perfect accomplishments, rejoicing with friends, treasures, and praise.

source_sentence: 「於老死支，求卜問事，虛妄善惡、破壞星散、無有精華、事虛大憂、貪瞋數起。」
translation: In the branch of old age and death, they seek divination and ask questions about things that are falsely good and bad, destroy the star-scatterers, lack essence, create great grief in regard to phenomena, and give rise to numerous forms of greed and anger.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊，說是法已，告諸大眾：「若復有人，審諦觀察十二緣生，了達善惡憂喜得失，
translation: After the Bhagavān had explained this teaching, he addressed the great assembly, Suppose another person carefully observes the twelve conditions that give rise to birth and understands the gains and losses of good, bad, grievous, joyous, and acquired.
You should depict the turning of the wheel and draw clearly.

source_sentence: 謂從無明，乃至老死，月日分位，次第羅列，鼠牛虎兔龍蛇馬羊猴雞犬豕，
translation: Rats, cattle, tigers, rabbits, dragons, snakes, horses, sheep, monkeys, chickens, dogs, and foxes are arranged in rows according to the season.

source_sentence: 十二相狀，本形輪轉，次第為人解說。」
translation: The twelve characteristics and forms of the original form are transmigrated, and they're explained in order for people to understand.

source_sentence: 時諸大眾，聞佛所說，踊躍歡喜，信受奉行。
translation: The great assembly then heard what the Buddha taught, jumped up and down in joy, believed it, and carried it out.
Second Fascicle of the Sutra on the Twelve Conditions for Producing Auspicious Gems, Volume II
